str2: And thence, and from there; and then afterwards. From kai and ekeithen; likewise from that place.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To sail away. From apo and pleo; to set sail.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.
From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
